alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kanawha, northern Raleigh, north central Wyoming, Fayette and eastern Boone Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 832 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Van, or 11 miles southeast of Madison, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Fayetteville, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Ansted, Sophia, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur and Bradley. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 40 and 88. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 131. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central, southern and southeastern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
